I just figured out how to do this with Julia which I am quite pleased about using Plots.jl! However, the code to make a title appear and have a colorbar appear is a pain to have figured out as it is not documented clearly anywhere or very nice to write. I wish that it could be something like `plot(x, data, title = "My Pretty Plot", fill_z = [RGB Color types]` and done. In the thread is the code I used to answer my own question from discourse here: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/how-do-i-add-a-colorbar-to-a-choropleth-map/57814>

P.S. This was my first gripe here so sorry if I was too complainy! :grimacing:

text:
```choropleth = plot(size = (1000, 600), axis = false, ticks = false)
for i in 1:length(states.geometry)
	plot!(states.geometry[i], fill = :gist_yarg, fill_z = [rand_vals[i] for x in 1:length(states.geometry[i].points)])
end

y = ones(3)
title = Plots.scatter(
    y,
    marker = 0,
    markeralpha = 0,
    annotations = (2, y[2], Plots.text("Rando Plot")),
    axis = ([], false),
    leg = false,
)

plot(
    title,
    choropleth,
    layout = grid(2, 1, heights = [0.10, 0.85]),
)

png(plotsdir("rando.png"))```
